main event: A civilian in Cincinnati, Ohio sighted a flickering, star-like object moving across the sky on January 8, 1956 at 4:23 AM.
interesting points: The object was in sight for 5 minutes and was concluded to be the satellite ECHO I.
The observer described the object as a round, metallic disc-shaped object that appeared to be motionless or nearly motionless, maintaining a constant altitude and not deviating from its course.
The observer noticed the object seemed to be oscillating from side to side and rising and descending at irregular intervals, which indicated to them that it was under intelligent control.
As the object approached the horizon, it appeared to gradually diminish in size, though the observer felt it was actually increasing in distance.
The object did not make any sound and did not appear to have any visible means of propulsion, but had a distinctive feature of a very bright, glowing appearance emitting light rays.
